metadata.title: CVE-2024-46780 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:nilfs2: protect references to superblock parameters exposed in sysfsThe superblock buffers of nilfs2 can not only be overwritten at runtimefor modifications/repairs, but they are also regularly swapped, replacedduring resizing, and even abandoned when degrading to one side due tobacking device issues.  So, accessing them requires mutual exclusion usingthe reader/writer semaphore "nilfs->ns_sem".Some sysfs attribute show methods read this superblock buffer without thenecessary mutual exclusion, which can cause problems with pointerdereferencing and memory access, so fix it.

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
